FuncDef:
The set chassis-id command sets a chassis ID for a specified chassis.
By default, the chassis ID is 1

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a chassis ID for next startup.
The value is 1 or 2.

Specifies a chassis, which is represented in the form of chassis type+chassis ID.
The chassis ID is 1 or 2. A chassis example is CLC1 or CLC2.

Examples: You must reboot the system after setting next run chassis id!
Please confirm,will you set clc1 next run chassis id 2 ? [Y/N]:y
Operation succeed,the clc1 next run chassis id is 2,please reboot the system.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When deploying a virtual cluster system, you must run the set chassis-id command to set a chassis ID for each chassis.
Implementation Procedure
After the set chassis-id command is run, the system prompts you whether to continue. Enter Y to continue. The configuration will take effect after the device restarts. Enter N to cancel the setting of the chassis ID.
Configuration Impact
The set chassis-id command does not take effect on a single chassis.
If chassis is not specified, a chassis ID is set for the master chassis.
Follow-up Procedure
Restart the device for the configuration to take effect.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
